reference.scope: VARIANTS [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] PHE-362; SER-363; MET-386; SER-684; TRP-703; ARG-732; VAL-928; ALA-1104 AND GLY-1163

comment.text: Probably involved in intracellular signal transduction by being involved in the initiation of type I IFN signaling. Phosphorylates the interferon-alpha/beta receptor alpha chain.
Observed in all cell lines analyzed. Expressed in a variety of lymphoid and non-lymphoid cell lines.
The FERM domain mediates interaction with JAKMIP1.

disease.name: Immunodeficiency 35
disease.description: A primary immunodeficiency characterized by recurrent skin abscesses, pneumonia, and highly elevated serum IgE.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. Tyr protein kinase family. JAK subfamily.

property.value: Primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma
Susceptibility to infection due to TYK2 deficiency
Expressed in granulocyte and 237 other tissues
F:non-membrane spanning protein tyrosine kinase activity

feature.description: In a colorectal adenocarcinoma sample; somatic mutation.
